case_vignette: A 34-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a 3-month history of pain in her right thumb and wrist that radiates to her elbow. It is worse when she holds her infant son and improves with the use of an ice pack. Six months ago, she slipped on a wet floor and fell on her right outstretched hand. Her mother takes methotrexate for chronic joint pain. The patient takes ibuprofen as needed for her current symptoms. Examination of the right hand shows tenderness over the radial styloid with swelling but no redness. There is no crepitus. Grasping her right thumb and exerting longitudinal traction toward the ulnar side elicits pain. Range of motion of the finger joints is normal. There is no swelling, redness, or tenderness of any other joints.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Rheumatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing pain in my right thumb and wrist that goes up to my elbow for the past three months.
Have you noticed any stiffness in the affected joints, especially in the morning?
No, I haven't noticed any stiffness, especially in the morning.
Have you incurred any injury to your arm, wrist, or thumb that you recall?
Yes, I slipped on a wet floor and fell on my right outstretched hand about six months ago.
Did you seek any medical treatment or have any imaging done for your hand and wrist after the fall?
No, I did not mention seeking medical treatment or having any imaging done after the fall.
Have you noticed any swelling, redness, or warmth in the thumb, wrist, or elbow joints?
There's swelling over the area near the base of my thumb, but no redness.
Do any activities exacerbate your pain, or is it constant regardless of movement?
The pain gets worse when I hold my infant son.
Are you currently taking any medications or have you tried any treatments for your symptoms?
I take ibuprofen as needed for the pain and use an ice pack, which seems to help.
Do you have any history of rheumatic diseases, such as rheumatoid arthritis, in your family?
Yes, my mother takes methotrexate for chronic joint pain.
Final Diagnosis: De Quervain's tenosynovitis.
